Music video for the song Kite by Japanese boy band Arashi in collaboration with Kenshi Yonezu that was featured on NHK's Minna no Uta program. The song was unveiled at the 70th NHK Kouhaku Uta Gassen and was chosen as the 2020 NHK Olympic Theme Song. A live performance of the song by Arashi was featured on the program starting February 2020. In April of the same year, the song was again broadcast, this time featuring animation from Kunio Katou.

(Source: YouTube description, translated)

A collaboration between animation studio Kamikaze Douga x rock group Tokyo Jihen: an animated music video for the song Noudouteki Sanpunkan by Tokyo Jihen.

Streamed exclusively through the docomo anime store platform for a limited time, this music video utilized a smartphone's gyro-sensor technology to give the viewer the capability to freely switch between two videos for the song: A new take on the 2009 song made in 2020 with full 3DCG animation (when viewed vertically) directed by Junpei Mizusaki and the prior 2011 live-action music video for the song (when viewed horizontally).
Music video animated by Takaharu Shimizu for the song jyou! jyou! by NINO and Evan Call that was featured in the music block of TV Tokyo's infant program synapusyu.
Music video directed by Takaharu Shimizu for the title track of the single Curry to Ieba by Japanese band Saboten Takamizu Haruna.

Music video for Keina Suda's single Carol. The short version of the music video was originally broadcast on NHK's Minna no Uta program during June and July of 2020. A full version was released on Suda's official YouTube channel on August 1, 2020.
Music video directed by Takaharu Shimizu for the song because by Japanese instrumental jazz-fusion band Jizue from their seventh studio album "Seeds".
Original music video animated by Nebiru for the song Erase written by Deguchi Ryou and performed by Tenjin Kotone.

media.description: Music video by Tarafu Ootani for the single Citrus by Japanese electronic artist Serph that is included on his compilation album "Nanotech Wizard".
Music video for Keina Suda's single Alba.

Find your spice. Live true to you.

A collaboration between all-female rock band SCANDAL x the company XFLAG, an original animated short: XPICE—a tale of heroes fighting to protect their city, and how they grow along the way. It's got a dash of courage, a pinch of teamwork, and a whole lot of heart. The short is directed by Tsubasa Nakai set to the song Spice by SCANDAL.

Kokyo, a city brimming with people from all walks of life, and the prime target of the mysterious group Zerogram. But Red Pepper and Wasabi—a duo from the superhero league XPICE—aren't going to stand idly by. Red Pepper's fiery punches deal with the baddies while Wasabi's healing touch cares for the wounded. Things seem to be going well on the surface. Deep down, however, Wasabi can't help but feel like there's more to being a hero. One faithful day, the emergency alert blares—Red Pepper's in trouble! Though unsure of their chances, seeing a teammate in danger helps Wasabi find the courage to rise to the occasion.

(Source: Official Site, edited)
Music video directed and animated by bobibobi for the song DERO by DUSTCELL.
Music video directed by Takaharu Shimizu for the single Tokimeki by Japanese band yonawo.

Music video for the song "Sugar Foot", by Battles ft. Jon Anderson & Prairie WWWW, animated and directed by AC-Bu. The song is included on the album, "Juice B Crypts".

In 2020, the outbreak of Covid-19 caused a global lockdown and restricted many activities and events in the world. This music video depicts the ’Great Space Robot Festival’ that unfolds to avenge cancelled festivals and events, in the hope that humanity will be able to overcome the crisis and move towards a better world.

(Source: Youtube video description)

1% no Koibito is a character song for Minami, and his first song in the Love Series. As Minami's first two songs were about in-universe music videos, this song serves as the first look into Minami as a proper character.

Note: The song was commercially released as the B-track to the single Heroine Taru Mono! feat. Inori Minase/1% no Koibito feat. Toshiyuki Toyonaga on August 26, 2020. It also serves as one of the random openings for the rhythm game HoneyWorks Premium Live.

(Source: Confession Executive Committee Wiki, edited)

Mizuki Haruno, who has been spending her days feeling blue, was taken to a live concert by her childhood friend, Nozomi. She caught a glimpse of the "exciting world there."

"Nozomi...I want to play in a girls' band!"

The story of Mizuki who became a high-school student begins now! This is a rockin' youth story woven by the four individual girls from the music band at Hakumai High School in a town in Hokkaido!

(Source: Taiban! Official YouTube channel, edited)

Romi, the princess from a fantasy kingdom called ‘Emotion Kingdom’, accidentally frees mind fairies that have been sealed and secured for a long time. These mind fairies have abilities to affect people’s emotions and behaviors. Romi needs to come to Earth and “Gotta Catch’em All!” before they make chaos in human world!

title.userPreferred: Pleasant Goat Fun Class: Mighty Goat Squad

media.description: This story-driven edutainment series features Weslie and his friends fascinating adventures in a mini world they have not discovered before in Green-Green Grassland. In each episode, those ordinary goats receive mysterious missions and become a mighty goat squad to rescue those who are in trouble. As they become small, they have chances to explore the inconspicuous places of their daily lives and see the world from a perspective they haven't tried. From each adventure, Weslie and his friends learn to build teamwork and friendship with their tiny important friends. The other way around, their tiny friends inspire them to break through their own limits. Keep your tiny curiosity and discover a big world with mighty goat squad!
